channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Tree has large rotten branches over hanging my driveway, 21st May
item.description:
I have reported this about 4 years ago and nothing been done !! The lime tree outside my house has v large rotten branches overhanging my driveway and the adjacent road . if they fall down they will kill someone!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 146, Old Bath Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
We have no street lights on Redgrove Road or kingsmead Road

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 39, Redgrove Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham

item.title: Tree obscuring traffic lights on roundabout, 20th May
item.description:
A tree in the centre of the roundabout at the junction of the A40 and PE Way is obscuring the traffic light which faces the traffic approaching on the A40 from town going towards Gloucester.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Benhall Roundabout, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mini roundabout sign not visible., 20th May
item.description:
Mini roundabout sign on (B4632) on left of road heading towards mini roundabout just passed The bank is covered by tree branches. I reported this last year and it still hasn't been cut. It is an issue as being covered you have no idea which way to go if new to the area of learning to drive. All it needs is to be trimmed and it doesn't take a year it would only take a couple of minutes.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 54, High Street, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Noisy manhole cover that rattles every time a vehicle passes, 20th May
item.description:
The manhole cover on the A46 outside Marlboro and Little Croft is loose and rattles loudly day and night every time a car passes - about every 5 secs during the day! The noise is disruptive and means people with bedrooms at the front struggle to sleep

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shurdington Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Small blue "Not suitable for HGVs" signface is too small, ineffective, and gets lost amongst other similar signs at same loc'n - sign needs to be more obvious to prevent frequent van & lorry jams and damage to legally parked vehicles in New St, Grove St, and esp Burton St (where you have allowed on street permit parking bays on both sides leaving c/w remainder narrower than either of the bays!!!!), 20th May

item.title: Pavement caved in, 20th May
item.description:
Skip has been collected and has put a hole in the pavement outside my house. House number is 112, this isnâ€™t on my driveway but on the public pathway, concern that if a car drives over it, it may get worse. Skip company has also taken photos for evidence, driver said itâ€™s because the weather is very hot and the tarmac was very soft.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 110, Caernarvon Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
